Special Events in Jacksonville Beach
Jacksonville Beach is a popular destination for many reasons. For one, it boasts more shoreline than anywhere else in the state. This alone makes it a desirable destination for families, groups, and gatherings.
Our hotel is more than a place to vacation, from the island-inspired venues and delicious menus to our team's exceptional attention to detail, we’re an ideal choice for every celebration. Be it a special occasion, like a high school reunion, or an intimate party like a birthday or anniversary, we have a space to make it memorable.
Request for Proposal
Plan Your Celebration
At Margaritaville Beach Hotel, we take the guesswork out of choosing. Our indoor and outdoor venues offer everything you could need for a great get-together.
For a breezy affair, choose our open-air event space, The Terrace. With panoramic ocean views as your backdrop, you and up to 150 of your closest friends and family can catch up and soak in the natural beauty.
We recommend The Terrace for birthdays, retirement parties and anniversaries.
Book Now
Our indoor event space is perfect for all sorts of celebrations—not just meetings and corporate gatherings. Here, you can configure 1725 square feet to the needs of your guests. Whether you need room to dine, dance or connect with old friends, bring everyone together before hitting the sand.
We recommend the Seagrass Meeting Room for high school reunions, holiday parties and Quinceañeras.
Book Now
Jacksonville Party Venues
The Terrace
The Seagrass Meeting Room
Catering & Menus
Crafting a delicious menu should be the number two‘ to-do’ after choosing your event venue. When you celebrate with Margaritaville Beach Hotel, our talented catering team will work alongside you to create something perfect. Treat your guests to delicious, island-inspired hors d'oeuvres, a formal sit-down meal, or a tropical twist on a classic dessert.
Catering & Menus
View Menus
The After Party
Our Jacksonville party venues aren’t the only place you can celebrate! Enjoy the time before and after your event with experiences that everyone will love. Take a look at our destination guide to see the entertainment lined up for your guests.
The After Party

Jacksonville Jaguars & More Sports Events near Jacksonville Beach
Your guide to enjoying sporting events in Jacksonville Beach
In Jacksonville Beach, chilled-out island vibes meet the thrill of game day in the city. Here, you can kick off your flip-flops and unwind with your toes in the sand, then rally your crew for a quick trip into downtown Jacksonville, where world-class sports action awaits. From the roar of the Jaguars at EverBank Stadium to the crack of the bat at a Jumbo Shrimp baseball game, this town serves up the perfect blend of relaxation and adrenaline.
Public Transportation to Jacksonville Stadiums and Sports Events
The quickest and most direct way to get to sporting events from Jacksonville Beach is to take a taxi or a rideshare. A thirty-minute ride carries sports fans from door to door. EverBank Stadium has a designated rideshare dropoff/pickup point on Beaver Street. The PLAYERS Tournament rideshare point is off ATP Boulevard.
The JTA (Jacksonville Transportation Authority) bus Line 10 brings beachgoers into downtown Jacksonville. At $2 - 6 per rider, this option is the cheapest way to get to games, but it does take around two hours. The JTA also operates a Gameday Xpress shuttle that picks up ticketholders from downtown spots like Kings Avenue and the Florida State College Campus. Shuttles are available for Jax Jags games and other select EverBank Field events, running two hours prior to kick-off and ending one hour after the game. Riders even receive a voucher for a free concession at the stadium.
The PLAYERS Tournament offers shuttle service from downtown Jacksonville and Nocatee neighborhoods.
Game day transportation takes some time and planning. However, it is worth it to wake up to waves on the beach in the morning, and join in on doing the wave in the stands in the evening!
Where to Stay When Watching Sports in Jacksonville
When it comes to catching the best of Jacksonville's sports scene while soaking up the coastal vibe, Margaritaville Beach Hotel Jacksonville Beach is your ultimate home base. Nestled right on the oceanfront, but only 18 miles from EverBank Stadium and VyStar Veterans Memorial Arena, the resort is close to the action, but still far enough from the crowd for relaxation.
Whether you are rooting for the Jacksonville Jaguars, watching championship golf, or taking your family to cheer on the minor league teams, the resort offers the best of both worlds, from beachside bliss to stadium thrills.
Ready to turn your game day into a getaway? Book your stay at Margaritaville Jacksonville Beach and let the good times roll. Check out our current offers to plan a winning vacation.
Jacksonville Pro Sports Teams
Previous Slide
Jacksonville Jaguars Football Games
When: September to January
Where: EverBank Stadium, 1 EverBank Stadium Dr
When football season hits, northeastern Florida turns into a sea of teal and gold, and there's no better way to dive into the action than with a Jacksonville Jaguars game at EverBank Stadium.
Just a quick drive from the laid-back shores of Jacksonville Beach, the stadium comes alive with its fierce fans and legendary tailgate parties. Each home game draws an average crowd of 60,000 spectators, but there is always room for one or two more!
Get a great view of the game wherever you sit, thanks to the stadium’s massive video screens. Jacksonville is also the only city with in-stadium pools! For a truly unique experience, get a special ticket to “the spa” and watch the endzone action from the deep end.
Check out the Jacksonville Jaguars schedule.
Jacksonville Jumbo Shrimp Baseball
When: April to September
Where: VyStar Ballpark, 301 A Philip Randolph Blvd
Head to a Jacksonville Jumbo Shrimp game, where minor league baseball meets major vibes. Throughout the season, the team hosts giveaways and fun promotions like wizard-theme nights, and typical games are plenty entertaining. Fireworks happen every Friday home game, and on Sunday Family FUNdays, kids can run bases after the games. Most tickets are $20 or less, and $2 hot dogs are a staple at the stadium.
An evening at a Jumbo Shrimp game makes for an affordable and fun night out when you are staying at the beach.
Check out the Jacksonville Jumbo Shrimp schedule.
Jacksonville Sharks Indoor Football
When: March to August
Where: VyStar Veterans Memorial Arena 300 A Philip Randolph Blvd
When the Jacksonville Sharks hit the turf, the energy is nonstop and the action is up close and personal. This arena football crew brings big hits, fast plays, and a family-friendly atmosphere. Seats in the “Shark’s Pit” give fans an up-close view of every tackle and touchdown. Home games tend to have fun themes like rock and roll, pirates and princesses, or Halloween in June. After the final score, swap stadium lights for sunset skies back at the coast.
Check out the Jacksonville Sharks schedule.
Jacksonville Icemen Hockey
For a cool twist on coastal fun, catch the Jacksonville Icemen in action downtown. The city’s premier hockey team delivers good times for die-hard hockey fans and casual viewers alike. Gamegoers can enjoy unique experiences like a “fan penalty box” or a ride on the Zamboni post-game. Games are family-friendly, but also enjoyable for adults. The arena offers group rates and many special events throughout the season. With a short trip into the city, Jacksonville Beach visitors can enjoy all the adrenaline of a hockey brawl before heading back to the shore to unwind island-style.
Plus, the second annual Margaritaville Night with the Icemen on December 26th 2025 might just be the perfect time to catch a game.
Check out the Jacksonville Icemen schedule.
Next Slide
Jacksonville Sports: Special Events
Previous Slide
TaxSlayer Gator Bowl
When: December
Where: EverBank Stadium, 1 EverBank Stadium Dr
As the sixth-oldest college football bowl game, this Jacksonville tradition has been lighting up EverBank Stadium since 1946, drawing fans from across the country to cheer on top-tier SEC and ACC matchups. Whether you are a longtime fan or just in it for the festive vibes, the Gator Bowl offers a week of parties, events, and unforgettable moments just a short drive from the laid-back bliss of Jacksonville Beach.
Check out this event.
Florida Vs Georgia Game
When: November
Where: EverBank Stadium, 1 EverBank Stadium Dr
Almost every fall since 1933, Jacksonville football fans have gathered to watch a showdown between the Florida State Gators and the Georgia Bulldogs. Dubbed the “World’s Largest Outdoor Cocktail Party,” the event is more than just a game; it is a week-long celebration filled with tailgating, concerts and community events that electrify the city. The rivalry is a Jacksonville tradition, but 2025 may be the final time the rumble happens in the city before it moves to a new venue for a few years due to renovations.
Check out this event.
The PLAYERS Championship
When: March
Where: TPC at Sawgrass, Ponte Vedra Beach
For a sun-soaked holiday with a side of world-class golf, The PLAYERS Championship at TPC Sawgrass is a can’t-miss event. While most sports events happen downtown, this championship takes place steps away from the shore. Held annually in March in Ponte Vedra Beach, just a short drive from Jacksonville Beach, this tournament is a major event with top talent and a challenging course. The action typically takes place over four days, with plenty of time to enjoy the waves in between.
Check out this event.
Gate River Run
When: March
Where: Downtown Jacksonville
As the largest 15K race in the United States, this annual event attracts over 15,000 participants each March. The course winds through the city's historic neighborhoods and over its iconic bridges. With live music at every mile, enthusiastic spectators, and a festive post-race celebration, the event becomes a community-wide party.
Check out this event.
